children.name: sampling
children.note: approximates posterior by sampling from it
children.label: category

children.name: exact (asymptotically)
children.note: approximates posterior exactly in infinite limit
children.label: category

children.name: Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC)
children.note: uses a dependent sampler (a Markov chain) to sample from posterior
children.label: category

children.name: gradient-free
children.note: only requires (unnormalised) posterior evaluations
children.label: category

children.name: single chain
children.note: works with a single Markov chain
children.label: category

children.name: adaptive
children.note: adapt sampling hyperparameters as it runs
children.label: category

children.name: Remi
children.note: adapts covariance matrix according to previously accepted steps

children.name: Delayed Rejection Adaptive Metropolis
children.note: combines delayed rejection (using multiple proposal kernels) with adaptive covariance

children.name: non-adaptive
children.note: do not adapt sampling hyperparameters
children.label: category

children.name: Random Walk Metropolis
children.note: oldest MCMC sampler out there

children.name: multiple chain
children.note: requires multiple Markov chains
children.label: category

children.name: differential evolution
children.note: creates proposals by combining current values of a number of Markov chains
children.label: category

children.name: (vanilla) differential evolution
children.note: combines the current value of two randomly-chosen Markov chains to form a proposal

children.name: emcee hammer
children.note: affine-invariant ensemble sampler that combines two randomly-chosen Markov chains to form a proposal

children.name: DiffeRential Evolution Adaptive Metropolis (DREAM)
children.note: combines current value of many Markov chains to form a proposal

children.name: Population MCMC
children.note: ensemble of Markov chains - each at different temperatures - used to sample from posterior

children.name: use gradients
children.note: require derivatives of (unnormalised) posterior
children.label: category

children.name: 1st order sensitivities
children.note: requires 1st order derivative of (unnormalised) posterior
children.label: category

children.name: Hamiltonian Monte Carlo (HMC)
children.note: follows Hamiltonian dynamics of particles on negative log posterior space to generate proposals

children.name: No U-Turn Sampler (NUTS)
children.note: a dynamic version of HMC which avoids ``U-turns'' in parameter space

children.name: Metropolis Adjusted Langevin Algorithm (MALA)
children.note: solves a diffusion equation of a particle so that its stationary distribution is the posterior

children.name: 2nd order sensitivities
children.note: requires 2nd order derivative of (unnormalised) posterior
children.label: category

children.name: Riemannian Manifold Hamiltonian Monte Carlo (RMHMC)
children.note: uses the curvature of posterior to determine speed of particle moving over negative log posterior space

children.name: Riemannian Manifold Langevin
children.note: uses curvature of posterior to determine a natural gradient that guides proposals

children.name: nested sampling
children.note: generates posterior samples from regions of parameter space in proportion to their probability mass
children.label: category

children.name: gradient-free
children.note: only requires (unnormalised) posterior evaluations
children.label: category

children.name: Rejection nested sampler
children.note: generates proosals by rejection sampling the prior subject to a likelihood threshold

children.name: Ellipsoidal nested sampler
children.note: fits an ellipse to active particles then generates proposals by uniformly sampling ellipses

children.name: MultiNest
children.note: adaptively fits a number of ellipses to active particles then uniformly samples them for proposals

children.name: PolyChord
children.note: uses slice sampling to generate proposals from prior

children.name: Diffusive nested sampling
children.note: uses MCMC to explore constrained prior distributions

children.name: Dynamic nested sampling
children.note: number of active points varies to allocate samples more efficiently

children.name: DyPolyChord
children.note: version of PolyChord where number of active points varies

children.name: Use gradients
children.note: require derivatives of likelihood
children.label: category

children.name: Galilean Monte Carlo
children.note: uses gradient of likelihood at edges of constrained prior region to guide proposals

children.name: Sequential Monte Carlo
children.note: uses a series of tempered distributions to propose efficient samples from posterior

children.name: Approximate Bayesian Computation
children.note: approximates posterior by reject sampling from the joint data-parameter distribution
children.label: category
